messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] attachment? was: Digest Number 3
messages.msgSnippet: Thats what I was thinking, I didnt open it. Just wondering if anyone else has gotten them, Thanks Elissa. Indiana Tami Ps. you can also scan your computer at
messages.messageBody:
Thats what I was thinking, I didnt open it. Just wondering if anyone else
has gotten them, Thanks Elissa.
Indiana Tami
Ps. you can also scan your computer at
http://housecall.antivirus.com/housecall/start_pcc.asp

"You must be the change you wish to see in the world"
~Ghandi
Networking for Central Indiana unschoolers :)
http://communities.msn.com/ChildLedLearninginIndiana
Children Leading the Way!
http://ChildEarthBasedLearning-subscribe@yahoogroups.com
Fun site for your kids or even you :)
http://www.neopets.com/refer.phtml?username=angel1bunny




----Original Message Follows----
From: <ElissaJC@...>
Reply-To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] attachment? was: Digest Number 3
Date: Wed, 28 Nov 2001 20:57:17 -0500

Iy was a virus. My virus scanner won't let me open it. It's the 4th time I
got it this week. If any of you opened the attachment, you may now have a
virus. I think www.mcafee.com may be able to scan your computer.
Good luck!!
Elissa

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] attachment? was: Digest Number 3
messages.msgSnippet: Would it be possible to set Yahoogroups to strip any attachments before the messages are sent?  I don t like the possibility that a virus could come across a
messages.messageBody:
Would it be possible to set Yahoogroups to strip any attachments before the messages are sent?  I don't like the possibility that a virus could come across a list like this where I probably don't know a lot of people.  I suppose my antivirus didn't catch it because I didn't attempt to open the file.  ::whew:::

Tuck

ElissaJC@... wrote:
Iy was a virus. My virus scanner won't let me open it. It's the 4th time I
got it this week. If any of you opened the attachment, you may now have a
virus. I think www.mcafee.com may be able to scan your computer.
Good luck!!
Elissa
